attributes.action: UK govt to make geothermal energy the principal supply of clean renewable energy
attributes.background: The UK govt to undertake the largest investment in UK renewable energy in our history.
attributes.additional_details: The average UK geothermal gradient is 26˚C per km depth. Drilling 4km bore holes across the UK gives steam heat water 24/7.  1 borehole can feed 4000 houses. This  means,  that for the 23million homes only  5750 bore holes would be required (100/county). UK land mass is 245000km so one bore hole every 60km. Industry could be provided with power. Heat and electric.   Old mineshafts are a rich source of heat too.  These are renewable the life of each bore hole is expected to be 100 years each.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want the Government to take responsibility for energy generation using geothermal energy, or provide financial support to industry to develop this. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make new building developments run off a minimum of 25% of renewable energy
attributes.background: We want Parliament to introduce a policy to ensure that all future commercial and residential building developments accommodating 50 or more people are powered off a minimum of 25% renewable energy sources.
attributes.additional_details: We want Parliament to help us make a cleaner future for all in the UK. Starting by tackling the biggest users of fossil fuels; larger residential buildings and workplaces. We want this as of 2020, the UK is 76.5% dependent on fossil fuels. This high consumption of damaging resources puts our future in jeopardy.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want new buildings to be powered by renewable energy, but we're not sure if you want the Government to require new buildings include renewable power generation, or that energy supplied to building must be from energy suppliers that generate a certain proportion of their energy from renewable sources.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

New planning regulations on all new houses - climate conscious energy supply: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594561

attributes.action: Increase Environmental Protection and Green Focus in Covid-19 Recovery Plan
attributes.background: The government must enforce stronger environmental protection within plans for Covid-19 recovery. It must implement a green focus and invest in active travel, energy efficiency, renewable energy, nature tourism, wildlife and environmental conservation, and other green projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite declaring a climate emergency in 2019 the UK Covid-19 recovery plan has an overly strong focus on construction and development at the expense of protecting the natural environment.
Polls show a public preference for a change to the economy and a greener focus, which was promised but quickly forgotten. 
The UK has failed to meet the majority of climate action targets. 
It is our responsibility to protect the natural environment, especially after it has provided us with so many benefits.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: The Crown Estate to forego any income from renewable energy projects in the UK.
attributes.background: The British monarch receives 25% of all profits from the Crown Estate. With the expanding renewable energy sector, mainly offshore wind farms, the monarch will receive a windfall of 10's of millions of pounds from green energy license sales. This money should be used to fund green energy projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Offshore Wind Sector Deal
The government will work collaboratively with the sector and wider stakeholders to ensure that up to 30GW of offshore wind can be delivered by 2030.

The Crown Estate and Crown Estate Scotland will undertake new seabed leasing in 2019, ensuring a sustainable pipeline of new projects for the late 2020s and early 2030s. 

www.gov.uk/government/publications/offshore-wind-sector-deal/offshore-wind-sector-deal

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The Crown Estate's income, including from offshore wind, is returned to the Treasury.  The Sovereign Grant is calcualted as 25% of the income from two years previously. We're not sure whether you want to reduce the size of the Sovereign Grant or stop the collection of any income.
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Restore the Fracking Ban
attributes.background:
The fracking ban was lifted on 22nd September against the wishes of many communities and without addressing the concerns about earth tremors and other issues.
There's no democratic mandate for lifting the ban wasn't in the last Conservative manifesto and it hasn't been approved by Parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
It'll take years for the fracking industry to develop and become economically viable if ever so it won't address the current cost of living crisis.
A large scale fracking industry will destroy swathes of our countryside that we need for growing food, for wildlife and our own wellbeing. 
Instead, we need to focus on developing renewable energy rather than fossil fuels that will pollute the planet and eventually run out.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Keep The Fracking Ban
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

attributes.action: Disable minister expenses completely until energy prices are level with 2021
attributes.background: Prohibit ministers from claiming any form of expenses for the duration of the current energy crisis i.e until energy prices equal those of 2021.All saved expenses should go back into supporting consumers or creating a fund for renewable energy sources or emergencies regarding energy throughout UK
attributes.additional_details:
1) the government should provide a level of support for the population whereby the consumer is largely protected from increased energy prices 
2) it is morally wrong for highly paid ministers to claim expenses while there are members of the population choosing between heating their homes & their families eating 
3) having a fund that is dedicated to renewable home-grown sources of energy and contingency for UK energy would safeguard the population against future energy crises

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses, including expenses claimed by Ministers, and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk

attributes.action: Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis through Renewables
attributes.background:
It's a no-brainer. This is the cheapest, quickest, most environmentally friendly, safest, most job-creative way.
- Underwater turbines to harness tidal flows and estuary currents
- Wind farms
- Solar panels farms.
- Battery technology to store energy.
- Insulation of buildings.
attributes.additional_details:
Overseas energy supplies are reducing and costing more. Yet we are not taking this God-given opportunity.  The above approach offers HOPE instead of threatening the environment by investment in more fossil fuel and unsafe nuclear power, as currently planned.
We petition the Government and Parliament to think of the good of our country, our global environment and its people, especially the many poor already affected.  Action, not words, are now urgently needed.  Let the UK lead the way for the world by example.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 
	
We're not exactly sure what specific action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You may wish to sign some of these petitions instead: 

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

Introduce grants for home battery storage systems:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610997

Reintroduce Feed-in Tariffs for domestic solar panels:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609063

Create new publicly owned solar energy company to address fuel & climate crisis:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611416

attributes.action: Reform the entire energy market and invest heavily in renewable energies.
attributes.background:
I propose the government invest heavily and immediately in renewable energies, so gas and electricity prices are independent, and energy is affordable.

Tax electricity providers who generated it using gas.

Investigate why we pay an exorbitant amount for cheap renewable energy.
attributes.additional_details:
Energy prices are going up to ridiculous and unaffordable levels. The government has neglected this for a long time and has to rectify the situation immediately, to prevent people from going into fuel poverty.

It also doesn't make sense that consumers who are with cheap renewable energy companies are paying huge increases because the price of gas has gone up. The government should own part or all of the energy industry so we can invest in renewable energy effectively.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about funding for renewable energy generation, however the Government already provides financial incentives and other forms of funding for such technologies, so it's not clear what it is you'd like the Government to do differently e.g. to invest in the development of renewable energy technologies, or to increase financial incentives to energy companies to build and operate renewable energy generating facilities.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

'Hold an urgent inquiry into the energy crisis, and remove VAT on fuel': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605609

'Increase UK green energy investment in geothermal sources': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597657

'Prepare & deliver a strategy for developing and using Tidal energy in the UK': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/598785

'Require new large buildings include renewable energy generation': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/600894

attributes.action: Use the current situation as a basis to reduce climate change and global warming
attributes.background: To use this opportunity as a basis for continued reductions in GHGs, by continuing to lower their reliance on fossil fuels, after this pandemic. Further they should increase the ability to work from home, free access to Internet, renewable energy, reduce meat production and dependence.
attributes.additional_details: We have seen unprecedented improvements to our seas and cities since this lockdown. Venice is crystal clear, the sky's are bluer, and animals have taken over the parks. This shows us how much the world can improve in such a short time and we should not erase this progress and "return to normal" we need a new normal that fully addresses the growing issues of global warming, climate change and continued environmental degradation.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Create a new energy market for renewables that is not linked to gas prices.
attributes.background: The energy market needs an overhaul. Renewables and gas pricing should be decoupled from one another. Energy produced by renewables should have its own marketplace and it needs to be done sooner than later.
attributes.additional_details: The energy price hikes prove that the energy market is broken, out of date, and not fit for purpose. When we choose to have our electricity supplied from a renewable source we should not be paying inflated prices due to it being linked to the price of gas.The government needs to intervene in creating a new renewables only market. This will provide much cheaper electricity prices for consumers, enabling more people to reduce their reliance on gas. It's a win for consumers and the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621874

attributes.action: We demand the UK stops the extraction of oil in UK territories
attributes.background: We demand that the UK government stops extraction of oil in return for renewable energy sources. New oil licences and oil exploration must be halted and current oil drilling phased out.
attributes.additional_details: The burning of fossil fuels, in particular oil, contributes hugely to climate change. As a developed country the UK has a responsibility to follow the examples of other countries and stop oil extraction. Even if it brings the UK money now, new oil licences will hugely contribute to climate change and will result in the need for much heavier spending further down the line, in order to prevent catastrophic consequences.

Invest in new nuclear and renewable generation to replace fossil fuels: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621050

attributes.action: Action to address soaring energy costs, consumption and supply issues.
attributes.background:
1) Review the need for the street lights between 9pm and 6am. Pass any savings on to domestic dwellings, and reduce light pollution too.

2) Pump prime renewable energies.  Nationalise the manufacturing and fitting of modern solar harvesting roof tiles which look like normal roof tiles.
attributes.additional_details:
Re-opening coal reserves isn’t sustainable or environmentally friendly.

The governments plans, even if worst case scenario, for reduced commercial/industrial supply and even domestic blackouts should not be acceptable.

rejection.details:
Decisions about street lighting are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to take action in relation to the means of production of solar panels, or you might like to sign the following petitions, which makes a related request:

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Create new publicly owned solar energy company to address fuel & climate crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611416

attributes.action: Set income tax to 1% Overhaul UK taxation system
attributes.background:
Impose a compulsory social contribution, on every financial transaction within the UK providing cash to the treasury taxing the same money over and again
To control of the economy add a surcharge to the relevant sector. Alcohol tobacco energy. surcharge pollutants, fossil fuels zero on renewables.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to the UK tax system, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like the Government or Parliament to make.

Your petition refers to a "compulsory social contribution", but it's not clear how you want this to work. We're also not sure what you mean when you refer to "surcharges" for certain sectors.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Subsidise Energy Bills via Higher Taxation Of Energy Companies
attributes.background:
Short Term:
Increase Tax on Energy company profits to re-invest in reducing the impact of the price cap increases on UK Households.
Med / Long Term:
Create a progressive Tax system to tax a higher % on fossil fuels vs renewable to encourage R&D and investment in renewable.
attributes.additional_details: Energy companies have and continue to report bumper profits amidst the Energy crisis, with Govt current avoiding higher taxation to prevent discouraging investment in renewable, whilst the general population is in hardship as price caps continue to rise.  A progressive tax system would enable subsidisation of household costs in the short term (removal of VAT an example) whilst incentivising the Energy industry to continue R&D and investment in renewable long term. Force a change!

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Tax 50% of the Energy Companies profits to help households pay bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

Subsidise energy prices to offset any increase in the energy price cap: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606586

attributes.action: Incentivise Landlord to Invest in Green Energy for Their Properties
attributes.background: Provide an incentive to encourage as many UK landlords to move away from the use of fossil fuels, with small incentives to use energy companies who only use renewable energy sources and larger incentives to install solar panels. Further measures could include incentivising electric boilers.
attributes.additional_details: The Climate Crisis is a highly important subject, and while many in the UK do not have the means to make a significant impact. This would help in a significant way towards eliminating fossil fuels from energy production in the UK with how many rented properties there are in the UK. There is need for our government to take real action, and this is just one of many measures that will help to take a step in the right direction towards the 'net-zero' goal.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We understand you're concerned about climate change and the role of improvements to rented properties in tackling this, but we're not sure what specific incentives you want to be put in place to encourage landlords to make such improvements.

You could start a new petition explaining specifically what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Reconsider the Chancellor’s approach for tackling spiralling energy costs.
attributes.background:
The governments approach to tackling the energy cost crisis is badly thought out and should be reconsidered:
- households that don’t need a rebate cannot opt out and allow more targeted support for those in need
- there’s no support for small business
- it does nothing for long term energy issues
attributes.additional_details:
As one of the wealthiest countries in the world it is absolutely scandalous that people are having to make the choice between heating and eating.  Although the measures that the government has proposed will help some households stay out of fuel poverty, many will still be left with a stark choice. 

Support for energy poverty needs to be increased and far better targeted. Support for small businesses needs to happen. Investment in long term renewable energy security must increase rapidly.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do differently.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. You might also like to sign this petition

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608007

attributes.action: Scrap the no recourse to public funds clause for the NHS workers on work permit
attributes.background: The government needs to recognise the challenges the immigrant NHS workers like nurses and doctors battle with given the low pay that hardly sustains their needs. It’s can not be right that  at this time of a pandemic of this magnitude, they can be denied access to public funds following this clause
attributes.additional_details: The Non EU overseas workers significantly sustain the NHS services. Considering the effect of the pandemic on the economy, They are four fold hit! Its logical that the gruelling shifts grappled with in the war of Covid19 pandemic leave them devoid of the energy for extra shifts that they rely on to sustain their needs, besides the visa renewal  and Immigration health surcharge costs. They need to legally access the public’s funds too when they can’t work. Stop this austerity and be kind to them.

attributes.action: The Government should subsidize Green Technology e.g. Electric Cars
attributes.background: The Government should help businesses that help the planet to grow. Money should be given to help them do more to tackle climate change. Electric Cars are an example.
attributes.additional_details: Climate Change needs to be dealt with and this is a way to do it. Taking the Electric Cars example, car pollution is a big thing and electric cars will take more petrol cars off the roads. Wind Turbines and Solar Panels should also be subsidized to build more renewable energy for the UK.

rejection.details: https://www.gov.uk/plug-in-vehicle-grants

attributes.action: Put people first before expensive green, and red tape initiatives
attributes.background: As a small time developer, creating new dwellings has become an astronomically expensive task, as well as increasingly slow process. These red-tape initiatives slow production of new dwellings and make them more expensive, which feed down to consumers such as first time buyers.
attributes.additional_details:
It is imperative to move to cleaner energy, but this cannot come at the significant cost of peoples well-being and quality of life. EVERYONE DESERVES AN AFFORDABLE HOME. 

An imposition of a vast array of measures on builders & developers has forced many away from the field and pushed up prices. These measures NEED to be relaxed, and the focus placed on the production of renewable energy. 

Example of expert opinion on expensive red-tape initiatives:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GhAKMAcmJFg

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.We're not sure what regulations you'd like to be removed.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Shift subsidies and tax breaks from fossil fuels to renewable for a safer future
attributes.background: Gas and petroleum companies are economically supported through tax breaks and hidden subsidies, UK is reliant on external suppliers at detriment to our immediate and global environment. Shift support to UK based renewable energy production and storage to create a stable and safe supply.
attributes.additional_details:
Although the government claims to not support fossil fuel industry through subsidies it does so in ways that are hidden to consumers.

Britain currently supports the fossil fuel industry through tax breaks and subsidies for exploration and research and development.  It estimated this at around £10 billion a year.

Not only does Britain not have reserves to draw on making us vulnerable to monopoly leaders, continuing the use of these as energy is detrimental to our ever more fragile environment.

attributes.action: Investigate the market price mechanism for electricity
attributes.background: Renewable electricity is relatively cheap. But the price of electricity is based on the price necessary to bring expensive gas-powered plants online.  I want the Government to take action to ensure customers are charged a realistic price for renewable energy.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this petition is to reduce the cost of electricity that is charged to consumers.  Electricity prices are based on the most expensive generators, not on an average cost across gas and renewables.  Electricity from offshore wind farms can cost only 5p per kWh.  Additional information can be found here:

https://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/2022/jan/opinion-renewables-are-cheaper-ever-so-why-are-household-energy-bills-only-going

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you're concerned about the price of electricity, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The wholesale energy price is set based on the cost of generating electricity, which the Government is not responsible for. 

The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

attributes.action: Nationalise power and invest in renewable energy infrastructure.
attributes.background: Stop the huge profits electricity companies are making at our expense. Electricity bills are a big driver for the inflation that is damaging lives and ruining the economy. One of the reasons given for Brexit was to take back control, if Europeans are able to apply a cap so why can’t we?
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the government to prioritise investment in renewable energy infrastructure, research grants for renewable energy and cap the price of electricity to ease the cost of living crises and bring down inflation.
The wind and sun are free! 
Energy companies should not make vast profits at our expense. The infrastructure costs and should be government funded.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Nationalise Energy Companies: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608056

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

attributes.action: Change the way Electricity is priced, removing the lock to gas prices.
attributes.background: UK Electricity prices are exceptionally high, owing to the tie in to gas costs. This is an unsustainable. Electricity costs must be based on actual modes of generation (nuclear excepted) rather than being tied to high cost Hydrocarbon fuels.
attributes.additional_details: If I buy all my electricity as 100% renewable from a supplier who does generate this power, they have to charge me as if it were generated by Gas. Their profits increase, my costs go up. This is unsustainable Electricity generation (An exception has to be made for Nuclear energy) must be able to be based on its source, ie renewable / Hydrocarbons. Renewables can be cheaper. This will encourage  investment in renewable power generation, help in the shift to low carbon Electric Vehicles, and heating.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.

Decisions on where energy suppliers source the energy they supply to customers, and how this affects the tariffs they offer, is a matter for individual suppliers

attributes.action: Cut household fuel prices and take gas and electricity into public ownership.
attributes.background: Halt or reverse increases in household gas and electricity charges and renationalise both industries so they can be planned and developed in the interests of the people, society and the planet.
attributes.additional_details: Privatisation of gas and electricity has been a giant rip-off. Increases in energy costs for households, public administration and businesses in April 2022 are chiefly intended to benefit corporate shareholders, pushing millions more people into fuel poverty. Nothing short of state ownership of gas and electricity can ensure that all customers are charged a fair price that also takes into account the need to invest in renewable energy on the massive scale needed to help combat global warming.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608056
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607983

attributes.action: Government to review reform claim of 100% renewable energy sale to consumers.
attributes.background: Call on Government to review and reform the current wholesale electricity market, to increase transparency on energy companies claiming their energy is 100% renewable source when over 50% of the energy being produced is clearly hedged against fossil fuels.
attributes.additional_details:
Consumer spending needs to be a major consideration in the shift to a net zero carbon future. Over 70% of people believe that what they do, how they live and what they buy can have an affect on carbon reduction.

Subscribing to a 100% renewable energy tarriff the consumer expects that energy from a 100% renewable source. Thus increasing the pot of funding in renewable energy infrastructure such as wind, solar, geothermal, green hydrogen and reducing the energy from fossil fuels long term.

rejection.details:
In September 2021, the Government announced that the Competition and Markets Authority will carry out a full review of misleading green claims, both on and offline, at the start of 2022. 

During that period, the Government published a "Green Claims Code" to help businesses comply with the law in any claims about their environmental impact. 

You can find out about the CMA review and the Green Claims Code here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/greenwashing-cma-puts-businesses-on-notice

attributes.action: New Act to BAN building in flood zones in the UK, and on UK wetlands, by 2023.
attributes.background: To pass a NEW Act of Parliament to BAN building on wetlands OR flood zones, to embrace the water flow for energy, from moving water power, and re-flourish and renew the same area space of wetland that we have previously lost, as close as possible to the original wetlands, to combat global warming.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the strategy for COP 26 to combat global warming and the  rejuvenation of our failing eco systems. To use renewable energies and go some way to combat fossil fuels. 

To re-introduce the ecological importance of wetlands, creating a place for floater to flow to instead of by damaging peoples habitats and homes. 

By BANNING building in flood zones, recognising the important of that land for our sensitively balanced eco structures.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about loss of wetlands, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We could accept a petition calling on a ban on new developments on wetlands or flood zones, but it's not clear what actions you want the Government to take to "embrace the water flow for energy, from moving water power, and re-flourish and renew the same area space of wetland that we have previously lost".

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Amend the Building Regulations Act 2010 to make Solar PV Panels mandatory.
attributes.background: We the Undersigned want the government to amend the Building Regulations Act 2010 to make it mandatory for all new build domestic and commercial properties to be fitted with Solar Photovoltaic Panels as standard.
attributes.additional_details: In order to achieve goals on carbon emissions the UK must decrease use of non-renewable fossil fuels. Harnessing the energy provided by the sun through the implementation of Solar PV panels will assist with this. While the widespread use of Solar PV panels and the subsequent saving on energy bills for the occupiers would reduce some of the financial burden on the 22% of the UK population living in poverty. As well as creating employment opportunities and helping minimise climate change.

attributes.action: Make sure at least 55% of UK plastic is recycled compared to the current 30%.

attributes.action: Implement a green recovery package
attributes.background:
Invest in:
-Clean transportation
-Renewable energy 
-Retrofit buildings to improve their energy efficiency
-Reduce waste and improve recycling
-Protect nature and wildlife and restore degraded habitats.
attributes.additional_details:
This is essential as the recovery package can either bring us closer or further away from our zero-net emissions target. It can secure our and our children's wellbeing. It can build a competitive Britain in renewable energy and transportation or see us fall behind other nations.
The Committee on Climate Change illustrated that spending on low-carbon activities would provide a bigger boost to the economy, in both the short and long term, than pursuing a traditional recovery.

attributes.action: Extend remit of Ofgem to regulate the sale of all energy products in the UK.
attributes.background: Revise the role and scope of Ofgem to regulate the sale of all energy products in the UK. This must include all hydrocarbons (raw & refined) as well as all renewables. Ofgem must also adopt an agile pricing cap model that has a fixed cap and also falls back in line with market prices.
attributes.additional_details: The Government must do more to protect consumers from unscrupulous profiteering or even the perception of profiteering. The sale of refined products (e.g. petrol, diesel) is currently unregulated and needs oversight. Furthermore, Ofgem pricing caps make no account of price volatility and do not mandate suppliers to pass on cost savings when prices fall back. Ofgem therefore needs a wider remit, better powers and more sophisticated control mechanisms to protect all energy consumers.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand you'd like to extend Ofgem's remit to hydrocarbons, but we're not sure what you'd like covered by "better powers and more sophisticated control mechanisms"

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or resubmit your petition without this extra request.

attributes.action: Reinstate the fracking ban and up support for renewables
attributes.background: We ask that the government reinstate the ban on fracking so our country can deliver on much needed climate commitments to rapidly cut emissions, and to ensure investment in safe, resilient and zero carbon alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
At a time when the country needs a solution to both the cost of living and climate crises, fracking will only set us back.  It will halt progress towards tackling the former, and at best providing temporary respite from the latter but with the real risk of extra investment needed to mitigate various risks associated with this water intensive, polluting and poorly regulated technology.

We call for the ban to be reinstated and for greater investment in renewable energy.

attributes.action: Suspend energy company share payouts and bonuses
attributes.background: To halt the outrageous increase in energy bills the government needs to interceed to cap the huge profits energy companies are currently making.
attributes.additional_details:
The government also needs to interceede to temporarily HALT the rediculously high bonuses and payouts being received by energy company bosses.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about remuneration for privately employed workers, including bonuses, are a matter for individual employers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: We want the government to stop Ofgem from releasing the price cap in October.

we the working class and families on low income call upon parliament to stop Ofgem from releasing the price cap in October.
the cost of living has got out of control under the conservative government energy companies, are making billions in profits while hard up families skip meals and starve.
attributes.additional_details:
we the hard working people of the uk should not have to pay for the conservative government mistakes for not providing cheaper energy alternatives such Renewables or nuclear energy.  or even nationalise one single energy company so the people have a choice of affordable energy. attributes.action: Use the next Energy Windfall to fund loans for easier access to Renewables.
attributes.background: Rather than keep giving Energy cost handouts, use a Fund generated from Windfall Tax on Energy companies to allow homeowners access to 'FREE' financing of renewables. This is paid back via a second meter reading, at say, 15p/kwh. Paid with existing bill until a point the cost has been repaid.
attributes.additional_details: Renewables have a 'payback period'. This, along with the upfront costs is putting people off having a viable and valuable asset to generate power installed. By giving access to 'up-front' funds at Zero interest, would encourage more domestic Solar installations. Fully self-funding by submission of a second meter reading at a substantially reduced kw/h rate, payback for a typical family is 6 years where 'tandem billing' finishes. Repaid funds can be then reused again for other causes.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.  We're not sure whether you want the Government to fund free renewable technology or to finance loans, because the text of your petition includes both.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Prevent Renewable Energy Providers increasing prices based on Fossil Fuels(Gas)
attributes.background: Renewable Energy should be expected to add to our diversity and therefore security to consumers. Not only is it counter-intuitive that companies can raise Electrical Tariffs based on the price of Fossil Fuels including Gas, it is imperative this link is broken and separate caps are applied.
attributes.additional_details: It is imperative the relationship between Fossil Fuel Prices including Gas are unlinked and the regulation of Electrical Energy supplied from Renewable Sources have separate caps based on the “actual fixed and variable costs” of such projects providing value to state and consumer and a “reasonable return” to companies selling Electrical Energy from Renewable Sources. This requires revised Policy and Regulation as the current profiteering is wholly flawed and doesn’t reflect market fairness.

attributes.action: Remove Tfl Ulez compliant cameras in poor communities in South East London

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about the ULEZ and local advertising for public transport are a matter for Transport for London and the London Assembly, not the UK Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to run national campaigns on some of the things you outline in your list.

attributes.action: Subsidise renewable energy production, not fossil fuel extraction
attributes.background: Following on from COP26, introduce a full programme of  government subsidies for renewable energy production and eliminate subsidies for fossil fuel extraction.
attributes.additional_details: It's already been agreed worldwide that the single biggest action needed to deal with the climate crisis is to reduce fossil fuel use and promote renewable energy. It's not rocket science. If the UK government made this switch in its subsidies programme tomorrow, the carbon based giant producers would be holding top level meetings the following day to urgently change their policies to renewables. And it would be just as good for business. Thank you.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to change how it funds the energy sector, but it's not clear what you mean by a "full programme of government subsidies for renewable energy production". The Government already provides funding for renewable generation, and it's not clear how you want this to change.

We can accept petitions calling for the Government to end financial suport for fossil fuels, although the Government says that it does give any subsidies to fossil fuels.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make Chain Shops Carbon Footprint Accessible To The Public!
